text: my name is Raul Casta and I grew up in
South of England I found love online so
I gave him my career to come pharmacist
and moved to Central India to get
married to love my life I now live in a
small apartment with my husband and my
in-laws when I first came here it was
quite stressful because everyone was
staring at me and it was so busy
there were stray dogs everywhere even
cows and it was just quite strange it's
definitely not me anything like things
breathe what I'm used to so very
different but I've got used to it now I
joined a vegetarian forum online and
within minutes a stranger started
talking to me and I wouldn't usually
reply to strangers but on this occasion
I did I was working in New Jersey at
that time and then I joined a vegetarian
forum and then I saw that one day Lauren
was online and so I pinged her and then
we started chatting online and I started
to think I must have known this person
in past life and just as this thought
crossed my mind the words came up on the
screen I think we knew knew each other
in the past in past lives about six days
from that day I told her that I loved
her in two months he had flown from the
US where he was studying his master's to
London to meet me and when we saw each
other we were like almost crying because
it was just two ecstatic and we spent an
amazing ten hours we went on the London
Underground to central London and I
showed him Big Ben and the Thames and
the London Eye and it was so beautiful
because it was nighttime and no one was
there and it was very romantic
Lauren booked two tickets for Nagpur and
she came here in the month of June and
immediately when she came here in a
period of a few days we went off to my
hometown in RV and there we got married
in a temple that I used to visit very
often when I was a kid I've chosen to
become an traditional Indian bride so
instead of wearing a wedding ring I now
wear a red powder called cinder in the
pattern of my hair and necklace called a
Mangal Sutra I've also had to learn how
to drape my own sari in my family its
traditional for the women to wear saris
during festivals and in many of the
festivals I get a new sari one of the
things I had to learn is how to make
roti I'm not very good at it but I've
been trying my hardest it's a lot harder
than it looks
we disagree moody with baton and Moscow
there was a communications gap between
us if I wanted to tell her something
there used to be some misunderstanding
which created a lot of problems but now
we just giggle a lot - at all because of
language problem she comes from a
different culture and have had to learn
to give her space than privacy when I
first came to India you wanted to visit
a temple because I saw them everywhere
and they were so beautiful but I was
really nervous but I would offend
someone and I didn't know the etiquette
- how you visit a temple and it's going
to temple while my husband's at work
I've gained so much solace and we is
really giving me strength and put me in
touching my spirituality and really
helped me cope with all the struggles so
it's moving
I genuinely that if my husband and I
hadn't of connected on that vegetarian
forum that our password across somewhere
somehow someplace it was just a matter
of time because I really believe that
it's destiny that we're together
